subject: RE: [junit] Re: JUnit considered problematic
msgSnippet: ... With the dynamic linking of Java, I would even say it is impossible at least for pre-conditions. Regards, Ilja
messageBody:
> > Now the great thing: When you compile your code the
> implementation can
> > be checked whether it obeys the contract. If not, a compile
> error is
> > thrown.
>
> I would appreciate a compiler that can do that, but I doubt there is
> one (for any language).

With the dynamic linking of Java, I would even say it is impossible at
least for pre-conditions.

Regards, Ilja
